vision.notes: Many damselfishes and clownfishes are brightly colored, suggesting well-developed visual capabilities for species recognition and communication. Inferred to be important for territoriality. Information inferred from Chromis ovalis.

mechanoreception.notes: As ray-finned fish, Pomacentridae likely possess a lateral line system for detecting vibrations and pressure changes in the water. This would be important for detecting predators, prey, and conspecifics. Common to most ray-finned fishes.

chemoreception.notes: Olfaction and taste are likely used for food detection and potentially for communication (e.g., pheromones).
